context: Reference interest ratesWe use reference interest rates as a basis for working out tracker interest rates. A reference interest rate is always set by another institution. One example is the Bank of England Base Rate. If you have a tracker rate on a savings account, we’ll tell you which reference rate it tracks. We’ll then tell you how the rate you get relates to the reference rate. (For example, the rate might always be 1% above the Bank of England Base Rate.)

answers: If you have a tracker rate on a savings account, we’ll tell you which reference rate it tracks.
